title: 1955–56 Hapoel Haifa F.C. season
text:
The 1955–56 <a href="Hapoel%20Haifa%20F.C.">Hapoel Haifa</a> season was the club's 33rd season since its establishment in 1924, and 8th since the establishment of the <a href="Israel">State of Israel</a>.
At the start of the season, the <a href="1954%E2%80%9355%20Liga%20Bet">league</a> which started during the <a href="1954%E2%80%9355%20in%20Israeli%20football">previous season</a> was completed, with the club finishing 9th. The <a href="1955%E2%80%9356%20Liga%20Leumit">new league season</a>, with the top division being re-named <a href="Liga%20Leumit">Liga Leumit</a>, began on 3 December 1955 and was completed on 3 June 1956, with the club finishing 6th.
During the season, the club also competed in the <a href="1954%E2%80%9355%20Israel%20State%20Cup">State Cup</a>, which was also carried over the summer break. The club was eliminated by <a href="Haifa%20derby">city rivals</a> <a href="Maccabi%20Haifa%20F.C.">Maccabi Haifa</a> in the quarter finals, losing 0–4.
On 15 September 1955 a new stadium, <a href="Kiryat%20Eliezer%20Stadium">Kiryat Eliezer Stadium</a>, officially called Haifa Municipal Stadium or <a href="Luigi%20Antonini">Luigi Antonini</a> Stadium, was opened with a match between a Haifa XI and a Tel Aviv XI. Hapoel Haifa started playing home matches in the stadium on 16 October 1955, starting with a match against <a href="Hapoel%20Balfouria%20F.C.">Hapoel Balfouria</a>.
Match Results.
Legend.
 
International friendly matches.
During the season Hapoel Haifa played one international friendly match, against <a href="Sunderland%20A.F.C.">Sunderland</a>, which the club lost.
<a href="1954%E2%80%9355%20Liga%20Alef">1954–55 Liga Alef</a>.
The league began on 6 February 1955, and by the time the <a href="1954%E2%80%9355%20in%20Israeli%20football">previous season</a> ended, only 20 rounds of matches were completed, with the final 6 rounds being played during September and October 1955.
<a href="1955%E2%80%9356%20Liga%20Leumit">1955–56 Liga Leumit</a>.
Matches.
